articles.headline: Indicted Matt Gaetz Associate Is Expected to Plead Guilty, Lawyers Say
articles.snippet: The indication of a potential cooperation deal came as investigators were also examining a trip by Mr. Gaetz to the Bahamas and whether he discussed running a so-called ghost candidate in a local race.
articles.abstract: The indication of a potential cooperation deal came as investigators were also examining a trip by Mr. Gaetz to the Bahamas and whether he discussed running a so-called ghost candidate in a local race.
articles.lead_paragraph: ORLANDO, Fla. — A former local official in Florida facing an array of federal charges in an inquiry that is also focused on Representative Matt Gaetz was expected to plead guilty, lawyers said in court on Thursday, an indication that the defendant is likely to cooperate as a key witness against Mr. Gaetz.
articles.byline: By Patricia Mazzei, Katie Benner and Michael S. Schmidt

articles.headline: Biden Takes Initial Steps to Address Gun Violence
articles.snippet: With legislation in Congress stalled by Republican opposition, the president ordered a crackdown on “ghost guns” and said the epidemic of shootings was “an international embarrassment.”
articles.abstract: With legislation in Congress stalled by Republican opposition, the president ordered a crackdown on “ghost guns” and said the epidemic of shootings was “an international embarrassment.”
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Biden, calling gun violence in the United States “an international embarrassment,” took a set of initial steps on Thursday to address the problem, starting with a crackdown on the proliferation of so-called ghost guns, or firearms assembled from kits.

articles.headline: Expert Witness Pinpoints Floyd’s Final Breath and Dismisses Talk of Overdose
articles.snippet: A pulmonologist told jurors that Derek Chauvin pressed 86.9 pounds onto the neck of George Floyd, who tried to push himself off the pavement with his fingertips.
articles.abstract: A pulmonologist told jurors that Derek Chauvin pressed 86.9 pounds onto the neck of George Floyd, who tried to push himself off the pavement with his fingertips.
articles.lead_paragraph: MINNEAPOLIS — It was a video everyone in the courtroom has been shown repeatedly, of George Floyd facedown on the street with Derek Chauvin’s knee on his neck. But this time, it was slowed down so the jury could see the briefest widening of Mr. Floyd’s eyes — what the expert witness on the stand on Thursday said was his last conscious moment.

articles.headline: Beyond Pandemic’s Upheaval, a Racial Wealth Gap Endures
articles.snippet: Billions in aid has been dispensed, and the social safety net has been reinforced. Will there be more ambitious steps to address longtime inequities?
articles.abstract: Billions in aid has been dispensed, and the social safety net has been reinforced. Will there be more ambitious steps to address longtime inequities?
articles.lead_paragraph: Not since Lyndon Baines Johnson’s momentous civil rights and anti-poverty legislation has an American president so pointedly put racial and economic equity at the center of his agenda.

articles.headline: China’s Forced-Labor Backlash Threatens to Put N.B.A. in Unwanted Spotlight
articles.snippet: Lucrative endorsements deals with Chinese sports brands supporting Xinjiang cotton could pull the league and its athletes back into another geopolitical firestorm.
articles.abstract: Lucrative endorsements deals with Chinese sports brands supporting Xinjiang cotton could pull the league and its athletes back into another geopolitical firestorm.
articles.lead_paragraph: U.S.-Chinese tensions, human rights and business are once again meeting uncomfortably on the basketball court.

articles.headline: Prince Philip, Husband of Queen Elizabeth II, Is Dead at 99
articles.snippet: The Duke of Edinburgh, who married the future queen in 1947, brought the monarchy into the 20th century, but his occasional tactless comments hurt his image.
articles.abstract: The Duke of Edinburgh, who married the future queen in 1947, brought the monarchy into the 20th century, but his occasional tactless comments hurt his image.
articles.lead_paragraph: Prince Philip, the Duke of Edinburgh, husband of Queen Elizabeth II, father of Prince Charles and patriarch of a turbulent royal family that he sought to ensure would not be Britain’s last, died on Friday at Windsor Castle in England. He was 99.

articles.headline: Boeing Tells Airlines to Stop Flying Some 737 Max Planes
articles.snippet: Airlines resumed flying the jet just months ago, after it had been grounded for nearly two years because of accidents that killed nearly 350 people.
articles.abstract: Airlines resumed flying the jet just months ago, after it had been grounded for nearly two years because of accidents that killed nearly 350 people.
articles.lead_paragraph: Just months after returning to the skies, Boeing’s troubled 737 Max jet is facing another setback.

articles.headline: Biden Details $1.52 Trillion Spending Proposal to Fund Discretionary Priorities
articles.snippet: The blueprint includes increases in funding to address climate change, along with beefing up education, health research and the Internal Revenue Service.
articles.abstract: The blueprint includes increases in funding to address climate change, along with beefing up education, health research and the Internal Revenue Service.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Biden outlined a vast expansion of federal spending on Friday, calling for a 16 percent increase in domestic programs as he tries to harness the government’s power to reverse what officials called a decade of underinvestment in the nation’s most pressing issues.

articles.headline: Amazon Workers Vote Down Union Drive at Alabama Warehouse
articles.snippet: The company’s decisive victory deals a crushing blow to organized labor, which had hoped the time was ripe to start making inroads.
articles.abstract: The company’s decisive victory deals a crushing blow to organized labor, which had hoped the time was ripe to start making inroads.
articles.lead_paragraph: Amazon workers at a giant warehouse in Alabama voted decisively against forming a union on Friday, squashing the most significant organizing drive in the internet giant’s history and dealing a crushing blow to labor and Democrats when conditions appeared ripe for them to make advances.
articles.byline: By Karen Weise and Michael Corkery

articles.headline: Complacency and Missteps Deepen a Covid-19 Crisis in India
articles.snippet: The new wave will hurt global efforts and vaccine supplies, experts say. Researchers are scrambling to assess whether new coronavirus variants are playing a role in India.
articles.abstract: The new wave will hurt global efforts and vaccine supplies, experts say. Researchers are scrambling to assess whether new coronavirus variants are playing a role in India.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — When the coronavirus first struck India last year, the country enforced one of the world’s strictest national lockdowns. The warning was clear: A fast spread in a population of 1.3 billion would be devastating.
articles.byline: By Mujib Mashal and Hari Kumar
